title: Introduction
text: R/RSVsim_contact_matrix.R function obtains contact matrices age groupings less one year. , socialmixr (https://epiforecasts.io/socialmixr/) package used obtain contact matrix age groupings nearest whole year, using POLYMOD data (https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pmed.0050074). contact matrix calculated total contacts population symmetric (assuming population data World Population Prospects United Nations). Within age groups less one year, contacts divided evenly according size age group (years). function takes two arguments: (1) country obtain POLYMOD contact data (2) lower age limits age groups.
code: # specifying the some age limits to use with the model age.limits <- c(seq(0, 2, 0.2), seq(10, 60, 20))  contact_population_list <- RSVsim_contact_matrix(country = "United Kingdom", age.limits = age.limits)

title: Introduction
text: obtain list default parameters run model use R/RSVsim_parameters.R function. parameters can changed using overrides argument; example override b0b0 (transmission rate coefficient) value 0.150.15. “fitted” argument refers parameters excluded - function return parameters named vector. Initial conditions defined parameter list. initial conditions given, assumed 0.1% prevalence primary infection compartment across ages everyone else susceptible primary infection. new-borns assumed susceptible primary infection compartment.
code: parameters <- RSVsim_parameters(overrides = list("b0" = 0.15, "b1" = 1, "phi" = 0),                                  contact_population_list = contact_population_list,                                 fitted = NULL)

title: Introduction
text: run model R/RSVsim_run_model.R function used. Cohort aging used age population. time, proportion cohort aged, proportion determined length time people aged (cohort_step_size) proportion total length time age group. simulated number people susceptible infected, whether infection primary secondary tracked model outputs. incidence detected incidence since previous time-step calculated provided model outputs. calculate detected incidence age-specific detection probabilities used, default parameters assume people (1%) age 2 years old tested. age-specific prevalence also calculated.
code: out <- RSVsim_run_model(parameters = parameters,                         times = seq(0, 365 * 10, 0.25), # maximum time to run the model for                         cohort_step_size = 5, # time at which to age people\                         warm_up = NULL)

title: RSV Transmission Model
text: deterministic, ODE model Respiratory Synctial Virus (RSV) transmission. package constant development, change without notice. current model outputs yet fully tested.

title: RSV Transmission Model
text: model adapted version susceptible-exposed-infectious-recovered-susceptible (SEIRS) deterministic, ordinary differential equation (ODE) model outlined : Hogan, . B., Campbell, P. T., Blyth, C. C., Lim, F. J., Fathima, P., Davis, S., … & Glass, K. (2017). Potential impact maternal vaccine RSV: mathematical modelling study. Vaccine, 35(45), 6172-6179, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.vaccine.2017.09.043, Nazareno, . L., Newall, . T., Muscatello, D. J., Hogan, . B., & Wood, J. G. (2024). Modelling epidemiological impact maternal respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) vaccination Australia. Vaccine, 42(26), 126418, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.vaccine.2024.126418. brief, model age-structured primary (first, pp) secondary infections (subsequent infection, ss) specifically tracked. force infection determined seasonal forcing function (β\beta) age-specific contact matrix (mean contacts per person, MM). population stratified susceptible (SS), exposed (EE), infectious (II) recovered states (RR).

what: Function to run a Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) rejection algorithm — RSVsim_ABC_rejection
title: Function to run a Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) rejection algorithm — RSVsim_ABC_rejection
text: Runs ABC-rejection algorithm.

title: Function to run a Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) rejection algorithm — RSVsim_ABC_rejection
code: RSVsim_ABC_rejection(   target,   epsilon,   summary_fun,   dist_fun,   prior_fun,   n_prior_attempts,   nparticles,   used_seeds_all,   ncores = 1,   fitted_parameter_names,   fixed_parameter_list,   times = seq(0, 365 * 5, 0.25),   cohort_step_size = 0.2 * 365,   warm_up = 365 * 4 )

title: Function to run a Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) rejection algorithm — RSVsim_ABC_rejection
text: target Values fit . epsilon Acceptable error target. summary_fun Function calculate summary statistics equivalent target values. dist_fun Function calculate error target summary_fun outputs. prior_fun Function sample priors parameters. Must return vector. n_prior_attempts Number random samples prior attempt accepted particle. nparticles Integer. Number samples approximate posterior. used_seeds_all Vector. Seeds used generating prior samples accepted particle. ncores Number cores. greater one run parallel. fitted_parameter_names Vector names parameters estimated. fixed_parameter_list List parameter values run model excluding fitted parameters. times Simulation times. Default: 0 365 days intervals 0.25 days. cohort_step_size Time steps run model adjusting ages cohorts. Default: 60 days. .numeric(cohort_step_size) == FALSE cohort ageing applied. Can maximum 3 decimal places. NULL: 0.1% RSV prevalence assumed people primary infection, seeded beginning simulation. people assumed susceptible primary infection. warm_up Length time-points exclude calculating likelihood. Default: NULL.

title: Function to run a Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC) rejection algorithm — RSVsim_ABC_rejection
text: List fixed parameters, max_t warm_up.

what: Create contact matrix for RSVsim — RSVsim_contact_matrix
title: Create contact matrix for RSVsim — RSVsim_contact_matrix
text: Uses socialmixr package access POLYMOD data calculate per-person mean contact matrix. age groupings smaller 1-year required, function calculates total contacts population nearest integer age groupings (required socialmixr package) splits total contacts smaller age groupings dividing uniformly.

title: Create contact matrix for RSVsim — RSVsim_contact_matrix
code: RSVsim_contact_matrix(   country = "United Kingdom",   age.limits = c(seq(0, 5, 2/12), seq(10, 70, 5)) )

title: Create contact matrix for RSVsim — RSVsim_contact_matrix
text: country Country use contact_matrix function socialmixr package. Can given country name 2 digit ISO code. United Kingdom default. age.limits Lower limits age groups run simulation. Ages must years.

title: Create contact matrix for RSVsim — RSVsim_contact_matrix
text: List including contact matrix (matrix_mean mean per person, matrix_contacts total contacts), age limits, age distribution used calculate total contacts maximum age contact data.

title: Get parameters for RSVsim — RSVsim_parameters
text: Provides default parameters run RSV model.

title: Get parameters for RSVsim — RSVsim_parameters
code: RSVsim_parameters(   overrides = list(),   contact_population_list,   fitted_parameter_names = NULL )

title: Get parameters for RSVsim — RSVsim_parameters
text: overrides List default parameters change. contact_population_list List outputs create_contact_matrix function. fitted_parameter_names Vector parameter names exclude list fitted. Default: NULL.

title: Get parameters for RSVsim — RSVsim_parameters
text: Parameter list. Default values: b0: 0.08. Transmission rate coefficient. b1: 0. Amplitude seasonal forcing transmission rate. phi: 0. Phase shift seasonal forcing. delta: 1/4. Inverse latent period. gamma_s: 1/8. Inverse infectious period subsequent (secondary) infections. gamma_p: 1/9. Inverse infectious period first (primary) infections. nu: 1/200. Inverse duration natural immunity. omega_vect: 0.35 less 5 years old else 1. Reduced infectiousness due immunity early life. prop_detected_vect: age-specific proportion detected. sigma_vect: 0.7 1 months old, 0.8 2 months old, 0.9 3 months old, else 1. Reduced susceptibility due immunity early life. alpha_vect = 0.4 less 10 years old else 0.3. Reduced susceptibility secondary infections age group. nAges: must obtained contact_population_list. Number age groups - length age.limits. age.limits: must obtained contact_population_list. Lower age limits years. matrix_mean: must obtained contact_population_list. Contact matrix mean contacts per person. max_age: must obtained contact_population_list. Maximum age years. age_chr: Age limits character vector. size_cohorts: differences ages days - used calculate size cohorts. rel_sizes: relative size cohort (age category duration days divided total number days). total_population: 1861923. Total population size. Sp0, Ss0, Ep0, Es0, Ip0, Is0, R0, Incidence0: initial conditions run model compartment - given prevalence initial conditions calculated function. List. Default: NULL.

what: Runs the RSV model using odin and dust — RSVsim_run_model

text: Function run transmission model cohort aging. Prevalence, incidence given time-steps incidence rate per day also calculated.

title: Runs the RSV model using odin and dust — RSVsim_run_model
code: RSVsim_run_model(   parameters,   times = seq(0, 365 * 1, 0.25),   cohort_step_size = 60,   warm_up = NULL )

title: Runs the RSV model using odin and dust — RSVsim_run_model
text: parameters List parameters RSVsim_parameters function. times Simulation times. Default: 0 365 days intervals 0.25 days. cohort_step_size Time steps run model adjusting ages cohorts. Default: 60 days. .numeric(cohort_step_size) == FALSE cohort ageing applied. Can maximum 3 decimal places. NULL: 0.1% RSV prevalence assumed people primary infection, seeded beginning simulation. people assumed susceptible primary infection. warm_up Length time-points exclude calculating likelihood. Default: NULL.

title: Runs the RSV model using odin and dust — RSVsim_run_model
text: Simulation output (dataframe). dataframe, age refers lowest age age group.
